classes.label: ScopedHistory
description:
A wrapper around a `History` instance that is scoped to a particular base path of the history stack. Behaves
similarly to the `basename` option except that this wrapper hides any history stack entries from outside the scope
of this base path.

This wrapper also allows Core and Plugins to share a single underlying global `History` instance without exposing
the history of other applications.

The {@link ScopedHistory.createSubHistory | createSubHistory} method is particularly useful for applications that
contain any number of "sub-apps" which should not have access to the main application's history or basePath.

children.label: createSubHistory
description:
Creates a `ScopedHistory` for a subpath of this `ScopedHistory`. Useful for applications that may have sub-apps
that do not need access to the containing application's history.

children.label: basePath
description: the URL path scope for the sub history

children.label: length
description: The number of entries in the history stack, including all entries forwards and backwards from the current location.

children.label: location
description: The current location of the history stack.

children.label: action
description: The last action dispatched on the history stack.

children.label: push
description: Pushes a new location onto the history stack. If there are forward entries in the stack, they will be removed.

children.label: pathOrLocation
description: a string or location descriptor

children.label: replace
description: Replaces the current location in the history stack. Does not remove forward or backward entries.

children.label: pathOrLocation
description: a string or location descriptor

children.label: go
description: Send the user forward or backwards in the history stack.

children.label: n
description:
number of positions in the stack to go. Negative numbers indicate number of entries backward, positive
numbers for forwards. If passed 0, the current location will be reloaded. If `n` exceeds the number of
entries available, this is a no-op.

children.label: goBack
description:
Send the user one location back in the history stack. Equivalent to calling
{@link ScopedHistory.go | ScopedHistory.go(-1)}. If no more entries are available backwards, this is a no-op.

children.label: goForward
description:
Send the user one location forward in the history stack. Equivalent to calling
{@link ScopedHistory.go | ScopedHistory.go(1)}. If no more entries are available forwards, this is a no-op.

children.label: block
description: Add a block prompt requesting user confirmation when navigating away from the current page.

children.label: listen
description: Adds a listener for location updates.

children.label: listener
description: a function that receives location updates.

returnComment: an function to unsubscribe the listener.

children.label: createHref
description:
Creates an href (string) to the location.
If `prependBasePath` is true (default), it will prepend the location's path with the scoped history basePath.

children.label: id
description: The unique identifier of the application

children.label: title
description: The title of the application.

children.label: category
status
description:
The initial status of the application.
Defaulting to `accessible`

children.label: navLinkStatus
searchable
description:
The initial flag to determine if the application is searchable in the global search.
Defaulting to `true` if `navLinkStatus` is `visible` or omitted.

children.label: defaultPath
description:
Allow to define the default path a user should be directed to when navigating to the app.
When defined, this value will be used as a default for the `path` option when calling {@link ApplicationStart.navigateToApp | navigateToApp}`,
and will also be appended to the {@link ChromeNavLink | application navLink} in the navigation bar.

children.label: updater$
description: An {@link AppUpdater} observable that can be used to update the application {@link AppUpdatableFields} at runtime.

children.label: capabilities
description: Custom capabilities defined by the app.

children.label: chromeless
description:
Hide the UI chrome when the application is mounted. Defaults to `false`.
Takes precedence over chrome service visibility settings.

children.label: mount
description: A mount function called when the user navigates to this app's route.

children.label: appRoute
description:
Override the application's routing path from `/app/${id}`.
Must be unique across registered applications. Should not include the
base path from HTTP.

children.label: exactRoute
description: If set to true, the application's route will only be checked against an exact match. Defaults to `false`.

children.label: keywords
description: Optional keywords to match with in deep links search. Omit if this part of the hierarchy does not have a page URL.

children.label: deepLinks
description:
Input type for registering secondary in-app locations for an application.

Deep links must include at least one of `path` or `deepLinks`. A deep link that does not have a `path`
represents a topological level in the application's hierarchy, but does not have a destination URL that is
user-accessible.

interfaces.label: AppLeaveConfirmAction
AppLeaveDefaultAction

children.label: register
description: Register an mountable application to the system.

children.label: app
description: - an {@link App }

children.label: registerAppUpdater
description:
Register an application updater that can be used to change the {@link AppUpdatableFields} fields
of all applications at runtime.

This is meant to be used by plugins that needs to updates the whole list of applications.
To only updates a specific application, use the `updater$` property of the registered application instead.

children.label: capabilities
description: Gets the read-only capabilities.
signature: { readonly [x: string]: Readonly<{ [x: string]: boolean | Readonly<{ [x: string]: boolean; }>; }>; readonly navLinks: Readonly<{ [x: string]: boolean; }>; readonly management: Readonly<{ [x: string]: Readonly<{ [x: string]: boolean; }>; }>; readonly catalogue: Readonly<{ [x: string]: boolean; }>; }

children.label: applications$
description: Observable emitting the list of currently registered apps and their associated status.

children.label: navigateToApp
description: Navigate to a given app

children.label: options
description: - navigation options

children.label: navigateToUrl
description:
Navigate to given URL in a SPA friendly way when possible (when the URL will redirect to a valid application
within the current basePath).

The method resolves pathnames the same way browsers do when resolving a `<a href>` value. The provided `url` can be:
- an absolute URL
- an absolute path
- a path relative to the current URL (window.location.href)

If all these criteria are true for the given URL:
- (only for absolute URLs) The origin of the URL matches the origin of the browser's current location
- The resolved pathname of the provided URL/path starts with the current basePath (eg. /mybasepath/s/my-space)
- The pathname segment after the basePath matches any known application route (eg. /app/<id>/ or any application's `appRoute` configuration)

Then a SPA navigation will be performed using `navigateToApp` using the corresponding application and path.
Otherwise, fallback to a full page reload to navigate to the url using `window.location.assign`

children.label: url
description: - an absolute URL, an absolute path or a relative path, to navigate to.

children.label: getUrlForApp
description:
Returns the absolute path (or URL) to a given app, including the global base path.

By default, it returns the absolute path of the application (e.g `/basePath/app/my-app`).
Use the `absolute` option to generate an absolute url instead (e.g `http://host:port/basePath/app/my-app`)

Note that when generating absolute urls, the origin (protocol, host and port) are determined from the browser's current location.
signature: (appId: string, options?: { path?: string | undefined; absolute?: boolean | undefined; deepLinkId?: string | undefined; } | undefined) => string

children.label: currentAppId$
description: An observable that emits the current application id and each subsequent id update.

children.label: element
description: The container element to render the application into.

children.label: history
description:
A scoped history instance for your application. Should be used to wire up
your applications Router.

children.label: appBasePath
description:
The route path for configuring navigation to the application.
This string should not include the base path from HTTP.

children.label: onAppLeave
description:
A function that can be used to register a handler that will be called
when the user is leaving the current application, allowing to
prompt a confirmation message before actually changing the page.

This will be called either when the user goes to another application, or when
trying to close the tab or manually changing the url.

children.label: setHeaderActionMenu
description:
A function that can be used to set the mount point used to populate the application action container
in the chrome header.

Calling the handler multiple time will erase the current content of the action menu with the mount from the latest call.
Calling the handler with `undefined` will unmount the current mount point.
Calling the handler after the application has been unmounted will have no effect.

children.label: theme$
description:
An observable emitting {@link CoreTheme | Core's theme}.
Should be used when mounting the application to include theme information.

interfaces.label: AppNavOptions
description: App navigation menu options

children.label: order
description: An ordinal used to sort nav links relative to one another for display.

children.label: tooltip
description: A tooltip shown when hovering over app link.

children.label: euiIconType
description:
A EUI iconType that will be used for the app's icon. This icon
takes precedence over the `icon` property.

children.label: icon
description:
A URL to an image file used as an icon. Used as a fallback
if `euiIconType` is not provided.

interfaces.label: NavigateToAppOptions
description: Options for the {@link ApplicationStart.navigateToApp | navigateToApp API}

children.label: deepLinkId
description:
optional {@link App.deepLinks | deep link} id inside the application to navigate to.
If an additional {@link NavigateToAppOptions.path | path} is defined it will be appended to the deep link path.

children.label: path
description:
optional path inside application to deep link to.
If undefined, will use {@link App.defaultPath | the app's default path} as default.

children.label: state
description: optional state to forward to the application

children.label: replace
description: if true, will not create a new history entry when navigating (using `replace` instead of `push`)

children.label: openInNewTab
description: if true, will open the app in new tab, will share session information via window.open if base

enums.label: AppLeaveActionType
description: Possible type of actions on application leave.

enums.label: AppNavLinkStatus
description: Status of the application's navLink.

enums.label: AppStatus
description: Accessibility status of an application.

misc.label: AppDeepLink
description:
Input type for registering secondary in-app locations for an application.

Deep links must include at least one of `path` or `deepLinks`. A deep link that does not have a `path`
represents a topological level in the application's hierarchy, but does not have a destination URL that is
user-accessible.
signature: { id: string; title: string; keywords?: string[] | undefined; navLinkStatus?:

misc.label: AppLeaveAction
description:
Possible actions to return from a {@link AppLeaveHandler}

See {@link AppLeaveConfirmAction} and {@link AppLeaveDefaultAction}

misc.label: AppLeaveHandler
description:
A handler that will be executed before leaving the application, either when
going to another application or when closing the browser tab or manually changing
the url.
Should return `confirm` to prompt a message to the user before leaving the page, or `default`
to keep the default behavior (doing nothing).

See {@link AppMountParameters} for detailed usage examples.

misc.label: AppMount
description: A mount function called when the user navigates to this app's route.
returnComment: An unmounting function that will be called to unmount the application. See {@link AppUnmount }.

children.label: params
description: {@link AppMountParameters }

misc.label: AppUnmount
description: A function called when an application should be unmounted from the page. This function should be synchronous.

misc.label: AppUpdatableFields
description: Defines the list of fields that can be updated via an {@link AppUpdater}.
signature: | undefined; defaultPath?: string | undefined; tooltip?: string | undefined; }

misc.label: AppUpdater
description:
Updater for applications.
see {@link ApplicationSetup}

misc.label: PublicAppDeepLinkInfo
description: Public information about a registered app's {@link AppDeepLink | deepLinks}

misc.label: PublicAppInfo
description: Public information about a registered {@link App | application}
